sections.summary: Allah revealed the Book in truth and is the only one to whom **sincere faith** is due. He created the universe with reason, wrapping the night and day around one another and regulating the sun and moon in their specific courses.

Allah created humanity from a single soul and formed them in the womb through successive stages in **triple darkness**. This developmental process includes the recording of an individual's **destiny (takdir)** regarding their provisions, lifespan, and deeds. Allah approves of **gratitude** but establishes individual **accountability**, noting that no soul shall bear the burden of another.

The Prophet is commanded to worship Allah alone with **sincere faith** and to be the first of those who submit. Those who reject belief face layers of **Fire** and are warned to beware of divine punishment. In contrast, those who avoid idols and listen to the Word are guided by intellect and will dwell in high mansions in **Paradise**.

Rainfall and the cycle of vegetation serve as a **reminder** for those with understanding regarding the transience of the worldly life. Those whose hearts are opened to **Islam** follow a divine light, while those with hardened hearts remain in manifest error. Allah warns that those who reject His signs taste disgrace in this life and face a worse penalty in the **Hereafter**.

The Quran is described as an Arabic scripture without defect, containing ideals to help humanity become **righteous**. Allah is established as sufficient for His servant, possessing the power to withhold or lift harm as He wills. Disbelievers are warned of an agonizing torment on a Day when their false gods will offer no **intercession**.

Allah holds sovereignty over all things, taking souls at death and retaining those for which death is decreed during sleep. All **intercession** belongs to Him, and the hearts of those who deny the Hereafter shrink with resentment when He is mentioned alone. On Resurrection Day, wrongdoers will be surrounded by the evils of their deeds and find no way to redeem their **souls**.

Mankind often prays in adversity but attributes blessings to their own **knowledge**, which the text identifies as a test. Allah encourages those who have transgressed against themselves not to despair of His **mercy**, for He forgives all sins. Humanity is exhorted to submit before the retribution arrives, at which point excuses will no longer benefit the **sinners**.

Those who lie about Allah will be gathered on the Day of Resurrection with **blackened faces**. Allah is the Creator and Guardian of all things, holding the reins of the heavens and earth. The text warns that associating partners with Allah results in the nullification of all **works**.

The entire earth will be in Allahâ€™s grip and the heavens folded in His right on a Day when the **Trumpet** is sounded twice. Judgment is passed equitably with the prophets and witnesses present, ensuring every soul is fully **compensated** for its actions. The arrogant are driven into Hell in throngs, while the **righteous** enter Paradise eternally to see the angels glorifying the Lord.
